result.execSummary:
The defendant David Reine Bundy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transferred to Waukesha County.
Concurrent with: 14CF346

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA treatment, counseling and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact, directly or indirectly with Caryn Macke. Defendant must not have any alcohol in his home. Do not frequent any taverns. May go to restaurants that serve alcohol but may not consume alcohol there. DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes: May serve in Waukesha County. Huber is granted for employment.  AMENDED 09-17-2015:  Defendant may receive inmate worker credit towards his conditional time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Reine Bundy

RCSD--1:51pm
Preliminary hearing on February 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant David Reine Bundy in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. BTC: WARRANT VACATED  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Warrant forwarded to RCSD for entry.
